subject: Re: [junit] re: junit process dies when calling ant
msgSnippet: Jeff, I downloaded the source for 1.5.4, modified Main.java to remove all System.exit code, and replaced them with just return .  Then call it
messageBody:
Jeff, I downloaded the source for 1.5.4, modified
Main.java to remove all System.exit code, and replaced
them with just 'return'. Then call it
ant-1-5.4-noexit.jar.

My Junit is now happy.

Thanks for the advice

-Dan

--- Jeff Tulley <j_tulley@...> wrote:
>
> > Message: 12
> > Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2003 13:39:09 -0800 (PST)
> > From: Dan Tran <dantran@...>
> > Subject: Re: re: junit process dies when calling
> ant
> >
> > Jeff, It is good to know the main cause of the
> > problem, If you find the reference to the patch
> > please let me know.
>
> It looks like the patch was never submitted; merely
> Filip Hannik was getting some feedback on whether he
> should go to the bother of building a patch file
> (IE,
> would it actually be accepted).
>
> This link is to the mailing list archives, where
> somebody suggested what to do instead of using main
> directly:
>
>
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-dev&m=107092087725940&w=2
>
> marc.theaimsgroup.com is a good searchable archive
> of
> all sorts of java lists, I'd suggest you look there
> for more specifics.
>
